My experience is only around the Parking forum, so my review is based on this specific experience. As someone who needed information on pursuing actions around an unfair parking fine it was pretty good to read, although there are plenty of other very good forums and sites out there too. It’s free so that’s another bonus. But as a normal person, just there looking for information, some discussion as needed and of course a little moral support, I was really shocked by the OTT attitudes and behaviour of some of the regular forum members. Snooty, supercilious, self serving and anti anyone new who’s just finding their way with a specific issue - without the new people who seek info and advice from it, this forum wouldn’t exist would it so why abuse us? I think the administrators need to ‘police’ it better. Just like any forum you come across, it has people there who for them being a regular on it is their life and it comes across that their egos are far more important than the purpose of the forum, which is supposed to be to provide altruistic help to members of the public. I’m afraid I did experience bullying behaviour from ‘regulars’ with repeated attempts to belittle me. There were also some very good people and some good tips but as usual the bad are louder, distract from the reason you’re there and tend to be what you remember.

This is the canary in the coal mine phenomenon. If we can't trust ORG600 then what is there left to trust in corporate Britain.  I recently chose a broadband company based on their recommendation. The promised cashback never arrived. I have emailed ORG600 and have had no response. All I need is a copy of the recommendation article so I can prove that the cashback is due.   I don't trust them anymore. And since trust is what their business model is based on I can't see how this company can remain as lucrative a money earner in the long term.  A reputation takes years to build and a day to lose. They should be taking this seriously.  UPDATE: I SENT TWO EMAILS TO ORG600 6 AND 8 DAYS AGO RESPECTIVELY (INCLUDING TO THE EMAIL YOU PROVIDED IN YOUR RESPONSE) AND HAVE HAD NO MORE THAN AN AUTOMATED RESPONSE. DO YOU REALLY CONSIDER THIS GOOD ENOUGH?  DO YOU HAVE ANY DATA WITH REGARDS THE NUMBER OF EMAILS YOU RECEIVE MONTHLY FROM DISGRUNTLED CUSTOMERS ABOUT CASH BACKS AND VOUCHERS THAT NEVER MATERIALISE. AND TO THE PERCENTAGE OF COMPLAINT EMAILS YOU EVEN RESPOND TO. AND THE PERCENTAGE OF SUCCESSFUL OUTCOMES TO CUSTOMERS FOLLOWING COMPLAINT. I WOULD LIKE TO SEE FULL TRANSPARENCY FROM YOU ON THIS IMPORTANT MATTER. (ALTHOUGH I KNOW BETTER THAN TO EXPECT THAT YOU EVEN HAVE SUFFICIENT RECORDS TO ANSWER THE ABOVE, OR WOULD WISH TO SHARE THIS INFORMATION IF YOU DID HAVE THE RECORDS).  Edit on 20 March 2019  This exchange with ORG600 is ludicrous. I am apparently always just one step away from a response, just send your email to this email instead they say. Then when there is no response it's because some very particular wording was not stated in the subject line.  Let's be clear here about the issue. This company promotes other company's services and expects us to trust them enough to spend our hard-earned cash at their recommendation. Yet, when it is provided with information that clearly points to customers being scammed or misked it does not even care to respond. We are talking here about a company that has revenues in the hundreds of millions of pounds (which they have profited from our trust) and they apparently won't even pay someone to read the emails that concerned customers are sending them.   It would be interesting to know if the company is going to rot since Martin Lewis sold ORG600 to ORG102. I recently contacted ORG600 regarding gas and electric options.  I was advised I could save £159 against my current spend which they stated was £1399.56.  The reduced cost, with an alternative supplier, would therefore be £1240.56.  Sounds good - not really as the annual cost has been grossly inflated.  My annual spend with my current supplier, after 11 months, is actually predicted to be £1137.41 and not, as they say, £1399.56, that is at the best very misleading and at the worst quite deceitful. £1137.41 is considerably less (£262.15) than their figure of £1399.56.  So their quoted savings of £159 is untrue and meaningless.  I have sent 2 e-mails to ORG600 asking for an explanation but have failed to receive any response.  Their so called predictions and savings are just pie in the ORG169.  As far as I am concerned there are only 2 factors that determine the best deal and they are, very simply, the cost per Kwh and the daily charge.  That is all that is required to make an accurate comparison,  Malcolm Cohen

ORG92 customer service has gotten worse. Their drivers have, on several occasions, indicated that a package was delivered, even going so far as to take a picture, only to discover they lied about having made the delivery. I have gone through the very painful process of contacting them, only to get no resolution.   The most recent incident began April 14, 2020. I ordered birthday gifts for my great grandson in Houston area, whose birthday was May 6, 2020. ORG92 indicated the package (with picture) was delivered on April 17, 2020. I ordered birthday gifts early because I was unsure how fast deliveries could be made during Covid-19. Some items were delivered on 4/17/20, but my granddaughter just told me today that one large package didn't arrive until YESTERDAY, May 6th, on his actual birthday. I discovered this today when I called my granddaughter to ask how Jasai's 2nd birthday went and if he liked his gifts. That's when I was told the driver knocked on her door to give her the package.  You might say, "Well done! It arrived ON his birthday!" However, as I have said to ORG92 customer service, when the drivers lie about when packages are delivered, it could create a problem if the item was NEVER delivered. It has happened to me recently, with the USPS. ORG92 indicated that the item was delivered and yet my friend in Chicago has yet to receive the item. Dealing with the postal service is just as infuriating as dealing with ORG92's customer service. Your package never arrives and your are out of the price of your purchases.   ORG92 seems to go out of their way to make it near impossible to get customer service. I'm writing here because when I attempted to chat with ORG92's customer service, I was switched to something called Just Answer. For the price of a dollar (which they claim is refunded) you then wait for the system to match you with a lawyer (yes, that's right, a lawyer!) who will then call you or email you the answer to your question.  Has anyone any advice on how I can do an end run around the ORG92 obstacle course. I've tried their chat, they no longer answer their phones, I'm at a loss.

I did the insurance Inside this website. I founded a good price but unfortunately the insurance companies reduced the price but grow up the fees if you leave them before the expire date. Brightside is one of this. If you used the monthly payments and you want leave them before the expire date (for example if you sold the car) they will be apply full amount of fees plus another £60 and they deducted the last amount (£60) from the full amount. In few words a FRAUD. That is a example that you found in the contract:  “If you decide to cancel your insurance policy outside of the cooling off period, the insurer will reclaim a proportion of commission back from us. We will apply a fee equivalent to that amount and deduct it from any returned premium from the insurer, or add it to any outstanding balance due on your premium finance.”  This is what I signed and unfortunately I will be pay. Read carefully before signing.

Thank you to the customer service agent who, today, (sadly whose name I cannot recall) gave me some essential assistance and whose knowhow has helped me change my dual energy supplier.  I was most reluctant to change to DD, after years of making quarterly cash payments with ORG55 without incidence or any late payments. However, the only saving tariffs SP offers are to customers on DD. This means that SP is effectively excluding many people from accessing cheaper tariff rates. Amongst these are elderly, disabled, people as well as younger people or families on low incomes, or even those who simply do not wish to use this online service. Furthermore, within the documents explaining the new tariffs there is no mention of this DD exclusivity. Shame on them! They claim that this is not discrimination, but is very helpful to customers. Their reasoning does not make up for freedom of choice.  The ORG600 agent who helped me patiently explore the possibilities also emcouraged me to eventually consider trying DD, which I have done.  Thank you!

I WISH THE SYSTEM WOULD ALLOW ME TO GIVE THIS ORGANISATION MINUS POINTS  We have just started on our new contract with 247 home rescue for gas services and landlord certificates. This service is prominently publicised by ORG600 . The contract was very easy to set up. Then we were asked to do some (unnecessary) work at significant expense as part of the service, which we declined.  We were also asked to pay extra for bringing forward our services to fit in with our landlord certificate. it was very difficult to persuade them to have appointments within 12 months of the previous certificate. They finally found times, and duly charged us for bringing the dates forward.  The day of the services arrived. They cancelled on the day. They gave us new times on the following working day.  Then, a few hours later, the plumber arrived when the tenants had left!  Today, they phoned to say the services would take place in the morning. Then, at 11.30, they were cancelled again.  This is totally hopeless.  We would strongly urge anyone considering a landlord contract with 247 Home Service to look elsewhere. Even ORG197, with all its faults, is infinitely more reliable.   Why ORG600 is sponsoring this service is beyond our understanding. its reputation has suffered considerably by association in our eyes.

ORG600 don‚Äôt check the quality of the insurance policies they recommend.  After an internet search in Aug 2019 on ORG45, we took out a single event travel insurance policy with ORG185.  A week later in September 2019, we travelled to the Airport and was in the departure lounge before hearing ORG106 had cancelled our flight. Thinking we‚Äôd be covered by our insurance, we made alternate arrangements with the airline (alt airport, alt date), this arrangement did however occur some minor costs.  On our return we contacted ORG600 recommended ORG185 with a claim for our occurred costs i.e. extra taxi‚Äôs, loss of transfers, purchase of new transfers and loss of night accommodation, total ¬£267. Only to get it bounced almost immediately via a email, after complaining they did but our claim up for processing via another company (travel insurance services).  After several unsuccessful attempts for updates from both companies, we got a call from a withheld number asking for confirmation of bank details. The caller refused to offer any other details other than she was from ORG185/travelinsuranceservices (I forget which), I in-turn refused to share my bank details on the grounds we don‚Äôt share such things with unsolicited callers and that even if genuine I didn‚Äôt want an unagreed amount of money dropping into my account and that being the close of the matter. I then got a series of emails asking for the same, which I again resisted for the latter reason. Then they assured me that no money would be paid without consultation, so I shared my details. For the next two weeks I got several requests for my bank details, despite them being previously shared and being part of the now very long email trail.  Two weeks later I again chased progress, only to be informed a Settlement agreement had been paid ten days previously. Exactly what I was worried about and was assured would happen. I then got a email confirming the settlement agreement and methods of appeal. Appeal I did and was rejected, stating the amount paid was correct, to their policy. Which I‚Äôve since read and found to be correct.   WHAT is the point of taking out UPGRADED travel insurance, if it doesn‚Äôt cover a mere ¬£267 of costs occurred when your flight is CANCELLED!!! They paid me 22% of this and made every step difficult, with their unprofessional and aloof behaviour. I hope nobody has a real holiday disaster, after taking a ORG600 recommendation and insuring themselves with ORG185!  BTW, ORG106 claimed the cancellation was due to circumstances out of their control and refused to consider compensation. So I lost a day of my holiday, lost my transfer, plus I was out of pocket and NOBODY put their hands up, said sorry or paid me what we lost!!!

I’m Christmas shopping, so I have a lot to buy, but after a half hour of shopping on this app, it automatically empty’s you’re basket so there’s no time to browse and pick up some extras that you wasn’t initially looking for. Unless you order a few items at a time which would mean multiple delivery charges. It’s absolutely infuriating when you spend time adding things to your basket and Broussard’s g for it all to be emptied and you have to start all over again. For this reason, I only shop online with ORG411 if it’s a must. With all other shopping apps, I add things to my basket as I remember about them then checkout when I’ve got everything. With this app I have to jot things down and try and blast through and find everything within the allocated time, it’s like a supermarket sweep. Also during checkout, on the upside I had some vouchers through my credit card, to apply and they went through no problem at all, but then it wouldn’t let me checkout for free delivery despite spending about £500, it would only let me “pay” when I tapped on the £3.ORG176 delivery option. It’s little things like this that make this app so user unfriendly.  I shop online all the time, I don’t go to shops, so as I go about my days, I like to drop things in my basket as I remember about them. I presume that the reason for the basket emptying is to make people checkout fast, but in my case anyway it totally backfired on ORG411 because,  for 1, it makes it a thought to use the app in the first place,  2, I have to paper and pencil a list and type and shop at a million miles an hour to get everything on one order unless I want to do lots of smaller orders and incur lots delivery charges.  I love ORG411 in the actual shops, very good customer service, but this app is just a headache for me. It’s a real shame.   Everything ORG411 sells is of such high standard and along with the good customer service and very reasonable pricing, it’s just a real, big shame this lets them down so badly.   Sort this ORG411!!

Watch out if you go to ORG600 for house insurance - CHECK THE COVER OFFERED BY THE COMPANIES THEY RECOMMEND BEFORE YOU BUY. These guys misled me into funding my account. I received no less than three emails informing (and congratulating) me that my account application had been 'approved'. On that basis, I transferred a not insignificant sum. The problems started when I went to make my first trade, but received an error message saying that my residential address was still being verified. Surely, if my account was 'approved', that meant that all checks were complete and my account was ready to use? Apparently not with IB! I would not have funded the account had I not been led to think that everything was good to go.   So, on to the customer support, which is really, really, really, slow and unhelpful. After an hour-long live chat with excruciating waits in between responses, I was told that someone would be contacting me by email soon to help me get it resolved ASAP. I accepted that, but, still annoyed, filed my own complaint ticket as well. 24 hours later, I had received neither an email from an IB representative (aside from another generic one reminding me that my account was now 'approved' and funded!), nor a response to my complaint ticket.   Having lost faith in IB and wanting to take my business elsewhere, I tried to withdraw my funds and close my account, only to be told that I must wait three days before I can do so. Given that I was misled into sending the funds in the first place, I think this is absolutely shocking.   IB may be one of the cheaper brokers, but it is clearly a case of you get what you pay for. Avoid them at all costs.

I want to say, everytime I purchase something that is "fulfilled' by ORG92; I have an issue. It is always the driver delivering it to the wrong address or not following the delivery instructions I provide.  When it happens, customer service is usually good about it. Not this time.  I received notice that my item was next to be delivered. About 10 minutes later, I received notice that it was delivered. The picture showed a rug outside the door it was left by. I do not have a rig by my door.   I tried to call customer service and was told no one is answering due to the pandemic. I then got online and started chatting with a customer service rep. This was all within 5 minutes of the delivery notice. I asked them to have the driver come back, get the package and deliver it to the right address. The rep said it was scanned and marked as delivered by accident. I said, I suppose the app telling me I am the next stop, the package being placed in front of a door, the order marked as delivered and a picture being taken is all an accident as well? The rep said it was. Again, I asked for the driver to come back and deliver the package to me. The rep asked me to wait until tomorrow for delivery, despite me telling her several times it was already delivered.   She continued to argue until I finally asked for my money back. My chat was transferred 2 times to a different rep. The 3rd one finally said he issued a refund. We shall see.
